[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Frictionless Data Platform (FDP) defines requirements for managing, validating, and integrating datasets.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: FDP supports data packaging, validation, visualization, publication, and integration.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: FDP integrates with GitHub, CKAN, and data repositories.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: FDP provides CLI tools and web dashboards for data workflows.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: FDP operates on cloud and local systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: FDP supports integrations with data analysis and visualization platforms.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: FDP ensures secure communication via HTTPS.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: FDP ensures 24/7 availability with minimal downtime.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: FDP supports localized and discipline-specific configurations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: FDP links to external tools for publishing and validation.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 MISSING-TAG2: FDP optimizes large datasets and metadata operations.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: FDP facilitates data packaging, validation, and visualization.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: FDP serves developers, researchers, publishers, and data managers.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: FDP relies on network availability and external services.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Data Package: Dataset with metadata for sharing.
Validation: Ensuring data meets schema standards.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 MISSING-TAG1: FDP follows data standards and repository integration requirements.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with GitHub for data packaging and versioning.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall support CKAN for data publication and APIs.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-003: The system shall enable integration with SPSS, Excel, and visualization platforms.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide a clear interface for managing data workflows.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process dataset validation promptly.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support up to a few thousand concurrent users.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store metadata and validation logs securely.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall manage dataset versions and history.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall comply with data validation and packaging standards.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall encrypt stored and transmitted data (TLS 1.3).

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to ISO data management standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall enforce role-based access control (RBAC).
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall ensure 99.9% uptime and secure API transactions.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow publishers to validate data against schema profiles .
[SUBSEC] 2.2 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall provide tools for embedding interactive dataset previews .
[SUBSEC] 2.2 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-FUNC-004: The system shall track user-defined metadata additions to datasets.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Verification includes tests for validation, compliance, and workflows.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: Validation workflows, metadata standards, and system architecture.
[SEC] 5. References: ISO standards, GitHub documentation, and CKAN specifications.
